meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be changed or altered.
meanings.sent1: She held onto her beliefs unchangeably, refusing to consider any other viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: The rules of the game were set unchangeably, ensuring fair play for all.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat unchangeably in the same spot all day, guarding its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: His love for her remained unchangeably strong, like an anchor in a stormy sea.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood unchangeably tall, unmoved by the passing of time.

meanings.definition: In a manner that remains constant or consistent.
meanings.sent1: The clock ticked unchangeably, marking the passage of time with unwavering precision.
meanings.sent2: His dedication to his work stayed unchangeably strong, never wavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent3: The sun rose and set unchangeably each day, like a reliable friend keeping time.
meanings.sent4: Her smile shone unchangeably bright, lighting up the room with its consistent warmth.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed unchangeably, following its course through the changing seasons.
